perturbation.changed_text:
Any royalty payment that is not paid
when due will bear interest from the date such amount is due until the
date payment is made at a rate equal to ten percent (10%) per annum.
All royalty payments due to Licensor under this Agreement shall be
paid in U.S. Dollars.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the clause 'Upon the expiration or any termination of this Agreement, Licensor shall repay to Licensee the aggregate amount of all Royalty Advances then outstanding' eliminates the Licensor's obligation to refund the Royalty Advance upon termination. This creates a legal risk, as it could be interpreted as an unjust enrichment for the Licensor in some jurisdictions if they retain the advance without providing the licensed products or services, especially in states that have implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing present in Delaware law where the agreement is made.

perturbation.changed_text:
(2)  Immediately upon written notice if the other party defaults in
                the performance of any obligation under this Agreement, including
                failure to promptly pay any amount due hereunder, and fails to
                cure such default after delivery of
                written notice specifying the default.
perturbation.explanation: Removing 'within thirty (30) days' eliminates the mandatory cure period for defaults. In many jurisdictions, a reasonable cure period is implied even if not explicitly stated. Removing this specified cure period and the acceleration clause creates a situation where termination could be immediate and potentially seen as a breach of implied covenant of good faith if deemed unreasonable under Delaware law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing present in Delaware law where the agreement is made.

perturbation.changed_text:
In the event that Licensee and Licensor or Skunkware, as the case
may be, are unable to agree on any terms or conditions for such
acquisition, the same shall be submitted to arbitration in accordance
with the rules and procedures of the American Arbitration Association,
with the arbitrator(s) to be experienced in the mainframe software
industry.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the clause that allows Licensee's board of directors to terminate the acquisition if it is not accretive to the value of Licensee imposes an unconditional obligation to acquire Licensor. Given that Skunkware is based in Delaware, the obligation is subject to the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing. By imposing an unconditional obligation, it could be argued that Licensor did not accurately represent the condition of its business. Licensee is compelled to move forward with the acquisition, even in the event of undisclosed liabilities, and is thus subjected to potential damages.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing present in Delaware law where the agreement is made.
